intro: Callista macropoda, commonly known as the large-flowered callista, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in native habitats. Callista macropoda is also valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture.
